theorems.title: Monotone Sequence Convergence
theorems.statement: $\text{If } \{a_n\} \text{ is monotone increasing and bounded above, then } \{a_n\} \text{ converges}$
theorems.description: A fundamental result in analysis that provides a simple criterion for sequence convergence. This theorem forms the basis for many convergence proofs.
theorems.reference: Rudin, Principles of Mathematical Analysis, p. 55

theorems.title: Uniform Continuity on Compact Sets
theorems.statement: $\text{If } f:[a,b] \to \mathbb{R} \text{ is continuous on } [a,b]\text{, then } f \text{ is uniformly continuous on } [a,b]$
theorems.description: Shows that continuity on a closed and bounded interval implies a stronger form of continuity. Essential for understanding function behavior on compact sets.
